intro: Tristellateia acutifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tristellateia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
